PathfinderAI was developed in-house at CDI. Dr. Petrova has published 50 papers on exoplanetary science. The hyperspectral imager can detect biosignatures from light-years away. The plasma wave detector measures solar wind interactions. Odysseus also carries a 'Golden Disk 2.0' with updated information about humanity. The mission control center is located in Houston, Texas. examples.input:
Output Generated. Write Memory.
Input Question: Why do stars twinkle but planets don't (usually)?
Memory:
Memory 1: Stars,are,very distant point sources of light
Memory 2: Planets,are,closer and appear as tiny disks of light (not points)
Generated Thinking and Response: Stars twinkle because their light, coming from an extremely distant point source, is refracted (bent) multiple times by turbulence in Earth's atmosphere. Planets, being much closer, appear as tiny disks rather than points. The light from different parts of the disk averages out the atmospheric distortions, so they usually don't appear to twinkle as much, or at all.
